$interpreted: : A few days later......
Frenzied Attendant: Miss Adelaide!
Anxious Attendant: The city was only just swarmed by monsters... Where was she going all by herself so late at night... Miss Adelaide!!
Hugo: ...Who's missing?
Flustered Attendant: It's the House's only daughter, Miss Adelaide Serafin! There'll be time for questions later, just help us look for her...
Flustered Attendant: Who... Who are you?! What are you doing here in the residence?!
Hugo: You should ask your master that. Where is he?
Flustered Attendant: Where did this nutcase come from?! Stop him!!
Hugo: You didn't even know about the secret passage in your own residence's prayer hall...
Hugo: ...You must be another outcast from the sect.
Hugo: Now, where did the leader of House Serafin go to...
Lord Serafin: ...Damn it, where the hell is she hiding...
Lord Serafin: You still haven't found her? Send some more men out to look, we have to—
Hugo: ...In Sdorica's presence residing. Don't you recognize me?
Lord Serafin: ......
Lord Serafin: So, the former True Sun has come to speak with me. And to what do I owe the pleasure?
Hugo: Why did you entrap Nolva Carpenter? I already informed the sect of her identity.
Hugo: ...Unless you wish to betray the sect—
Lord Serafin: ...Ah, but the Second Parhelion insisted. A test for Miss Carpenter, she said.
Lord Serafin: If the voice that she hears is really the master we serve, this minor upset won't cause us any real difficulties.
Hugo: ...I am no longer the True Sun, and so no longer to be taken seriously. Is that what the Second Parhelion means by this?
Lord Serafin: Don't take it personally. Miss Carpenter has proven herself most excellently.
Lord Serafin: Second Parhelion anticipated that you would come to find me. I have a message for you: You are to take Miss Carpenter to the north without delay.
Lord Serafin: As for the Kingdom of the Sun—she will deal with it herself.
Hugo: This time it's just a test. What about next time?
Lord Serafin: I'm just a messenger... And now it's risky for the two of you to remain here in the Kingdom. Think it over, will you?
Hugo: Why does the Second want us to go north? Is this another test for Nolva Carpenter?
Lord Serafin: I don't know. But she said there would be others waiting for you there.
Lord Serafin: We share the same goal—to revive Sdorica. Isn't that what's most important now?
Hugo: ...Very well. But the Desert Kingdom has been sealed off. There's no way north by sea now...
Lord Serafin: About that... Allow me to introduce you to someone...

Model.Text: A few days later......
Miss Adelaide!
The city was only just swarmed by monsters... Where was she going all by herself so late at night... Miss Adelaide!!
...Who's missing?
It's the House's only daughter, Miss Adelaide Serafin! There'll be time for questions later, just help us look for her...
Who... Who are you?! What are you doing here in the residence?!
You should ask your master that. Where is he?
Where did this nutcase come from?! Stop him!!
You didn't even know about the secret passage in your own residence's prayer hall...
...You must be another outcast from the sect.
Now, where did the leader of House Serafin go to...
...Damn it, where the hell is she hiding...
You still haven't found her? Send some more men out to look, we have to—
...In Sdorica's presence residing. Don't you recognize me?
So, the former True Sun has come to speak with me. And to what do I owe the pleasure?
Why did you entrap Nolva Carpenter? I already informed the sect of her identity.
...Unless you wish to betray the sect—
...Ah, but the Second Parhelion insisted. A test for Miss Carpenter, she said.
If the voice that she hears is really the master we serve, this minor upset won't cause us any real difficulties.
...I am no longer the True Sun, and so no longer to be taken seriously. Is that what the Second Parhelion means by this?
Don't take it personally. Miss Carpenter has proven herself most excellently.
Second Parhelion anticipated that you would come to find me. I have a message for you: You are to take Miss Carpenter to the north without delay.
As for the Kingdom of the Sun—she will deal with it herself.
This time it's just a test. What about next time?
I'm just a messenger... And now it's risky for the two of you to remain here in the Kingdom. Think it over, will you?
Why does the Second want us to go north? Is this another test for Nolva Carpenter?
I don't know. But she said there would be others waiting for you there.
We share the same goal—to revive Sdorica. Isn't that what's most important now?
...Very well. But the Desert Kingdom has been sealed off. There's no way north by sea now...
About that... Allow me to introduce you to someone...
